intro: Belenidium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species that are typically perennial herbs with distinctive, often waxy, leaves. Belenidium species are native to various regions in Europe and Asia, often growing in moist, shaded environments. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value, though some species contain toxic compounds.
